fields.summary: Ephemeral block device mappings are displayed incorrectly

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All,

Please see below from Eucalyptus cloud with following details

{code}
# euca-version
euca2ools 3.0.2-18-gd640f7f (Omega)
eucalyptus 3.4.0
{code}

{code}
# euca-describe-images emi-CA1351FA --debug
2013-10-15 03:58:49,670 DEBUG   DescribeImages parsed arguments: {'all': False, 'userregion': None, 'filters': None, 'url': None, 'ImageId': ['emi-CA1351FA'], 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'Owner': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'ExecutableBy': None}
2013-10-15 03:58:49,670 DEBUG   Config searching regions for option 'ec2-url'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,670 DEBUG   Config   section 'aws:us-east-1'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,671 INFO    Config option 'ec2-url' = 'https://ec2.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,671 DEBUG   Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,671 DEBUG   Config   section 'aws:us-east-1'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,671 DEBUG   Config   section 'aws:*'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,671 INFO    Config option 'verify-ssl' = 'true'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,675 INFO    DescribeImages parameters: {'Action': 'DescribeImages', 'ImageId.1': 'emi-CA1351FA', 'Version': '2013-02-01'}
2013-10-15 03:58:49,675 INFO    Eucalyptus sending request (attempt 1 of 3)
2013-10-15 03:58:49,676 DEBUG   EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\n10.104.1.210:8773\n/services/Eucalyptus\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKI4DIZ8QQWPX98KLIK2&Action=DescribeImages&ImageId.1=emi-CA1351FA&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-10-15T10%3A58%3A49Z&Version=2013-02-01'
2013-10-15 03:58:49,676 DEBUG   EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth b64-encoded signature: McX6z/f38Ty/c2TYLureSYuV4lunnkmDHH7PXlMWqFg=
2013-10-15 03:58:49,676 DEBUG   EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth converting params to POST data
2013-10-15 03:58:49,683 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request method: POST
2013-10-15 03:58:49,683 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request url:    http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Eucalyptus
2013-10-15 03:58:49,683 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request header: Content-Length: 241
2013-10-15 03:58:49,683 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
2013-10-15 03:58:49,683 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request header: Host: 10.104.1.210:8773
2013-10-15 03:58:49,683 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.2-18-gd640f7f (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-358.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0-beta2 requests/1.1.0
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   AWSAccessKeyId: AKI4DIZ8QQWPX98KLIK2
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   Action: DescribeImages
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   ImageId.1: emi-CA1351FA
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   Signature: McX6z/f38Ty/c2TYLureSYuV4lunnkmDHH7PXlMWqFg=
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   SignatureMethod: HmacSHA256
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   SignatureVersion: 2
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   Timestamp: 2013-10-15T10:58:49Z
2013-10-15 03:58:49,684 DEBUG   Eucalyptus request data:   Version: 2013-02-01
2013-10-15 03:58:49,751 DEBUG   Eucalyptus response time: 0.066 seconds
2013-10-15 03:58:49,752 INFO    Eucalyptus response status: 200
2013-10-15 03:58:49,752 DEBUG   Eucalyptus response header: content-length: 975
2013-10-15 03:58:49,752 DEBUG   Eucalyptus response header: content-type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8
2013-10-15 03:58:49,752 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- response content --
{code}

And in the end the response received from server

{code}
<DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2013-02-01/">
<imagesSet>
<item>
<imageId>emi-CA1351FA</imageId>
<imageLocation>492776843771/TEST</imageLocation>
<imageState>available</imageState>
<imageOwnerId>492776843771</imageOwnerId>
<isPublic>false</isPublic>
<productCodes/>
<architecture>x86_64</architecture>
<imageType>machine</imageType>
<platform/>
<name>TEST</name>
<rootDeviceType>ebs</rootDeviceType>
<rootDeviceName>/dev/sda</rootDeviceName>
<blockDeviceMapping>
<item>
<deviceName>/dev/sdb</deviceName>
<virtualName>ephemeral0</virtualName>
</item>
<item>
<deviceName>/dev/sdc</deviceName>
<ebs>
<volumeSize>2</volumeSize>
<deleteOnTermination>true</deleteOnTermination>
</ebs>
</item>
<item>
<deviceName>/dev/sda</deviceName>
<ebs>
<snapshotId>snap-BAEE4224</snapshotId>
<volumeSize>14</volumeSize>
<deleteOnTermination>true</deleteOnTermination>
</ebs>
</item>
</blockDeviceMapping>
<virtualizationType>hvm</virtualizationType>
<tagSet/>
</item>
</imagesSet>
</DescribeImagesResponse>
{code}

Finally

{code}
2013-10-15 03:58:49,753 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- end of response content --
IMAGE	emi-CA1351FA	492776843771/TEST	492776843771	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm	
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdb			
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdc		2	true
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sda	snap-BAEE4224	14	true
{code}

Note the /dev/sdb is an ephemeral BDM as confirmed by server response. Now same thing when ran in EC2 (ec2-describe-images provided by ec2 api tools version 1.6.11.0 (2013-10-01)

{code}
------------------------------[ RESPONSE ]------------------------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <soap:Body>
    <DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2013-10-01/">
      <requestId>f212daa1-7567-496d-9cf4-e7e8455c16fc</requestId>
      <imagesSet>
        <item>
          <imageId>ami-5de1b234</imageId>
          <imageLocation>048212016277/TEST2</imageLocation>
          <imageState>available</imageState>
          <imageOwnerId>ll</imageOwnerId>
          <isPublic>false</isPublic>
          <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
          <imageType>machine</imageType>
          <kernelId>aki-88aa75e1</kernelId>
          <name>TEST2</name>
          <rootDeviceType>ebs</rootDeviceType>
          <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda1</rootDeviceName>
          <blockDeviceMapping>
            <item>
              <deviceName>/dev/sda1</deviceName>
              <ebs>
                <snapshotId>snap-bcbfb3be</snapshotId>
                <volumeSize>8</volumeSize>
                <deleteOnTermination>true</deleteOnTermination>
                <volumeType>standard</volumeType>
              </ebs>
            </item>
            <item>
              <deviceName>/dev/sdb</deviceName>
              <virtualName>ephemeral0</virtualName>
            </item>
          </blockDeviceMapping>
          <virtualizationType>paravirtual</virtualizationType>
          <hypervisor>xen</hypervisor>
        </item>
      </imagesSet>
    </DescribeImagesResponse>
  </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

------------------------------------------------------------------------
IMAGE	ami-5de1b234	048212016277/TEST2	048212016277	available	private		x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			ebs	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sda1		snap-bcbfb3be	8	true	standard	
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EPHEMERAL	/dev/sdb	ephemeral0
{code}

Note the display here. Server response is same as Eucalyptus but the tool is displaying properly what exactly "/dev/sdb" is and that is an ephemeral BDM

This is a BUG IMHO and should be fixed to improve visibility of ephemeral BDM as well as Tool compatibility with EC2 API Tools.

Please let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: ephemeral BDM should be shown correctly
fields.environment:
